results.title: Jennifer Hudson Knew Aretha Franklin. To Play Her, She Had to Learn More.
results.abstract: For the new biopic “Respect,” the singer researched the life of a yearslong friend and role model to better understand the circumstances that shaped her.

multimedia.caption: Every musical artist has to “cross paths with Aretha, especially if you want to be great,” Jennifer Hudson said.

results.title: Udo Kier’s Latest Provocation: Leading Man
results.abstract: At 76, the German actor known for outré character roles says he had “no fear whatsoever” when it came to starring in the American tale “Swan Song.”

results.title: ‘Evangelion’ Director Explains How He Finally Found His Ending
results.abstract: Hideaki Anno is concluding the story of Shinji Ikari and company in a film due on Amazon this month but says, “There might come a time when I meet them again.”

multimedia.caption: Hideaki Anno said the popularity of the “Evangelion” series moved him to make the films, but he doesn’t expect “that kind of opportunity will occur again.”

results.title: Marcia Nasatir, Who Broke a Glass Ceiling in Hollywood, Dies at 95

results.title: Dramatizing the Chernobyl Disaster, for Its Survivors
results.abstract: Unlike the recent HBO series, the Russian-language feature film “Chernobyl 1986” explores the human toll of the power plant explosion.

results.title: Arthur French, Negro Ensemble Company Pioneer, Dies at 89
results.abstract: He more or less stumbled into a career as an actor, but it proved to be a long and prolific one, on film, on television and especially on the stage.
